string.value: We're picking out some good quests for you now...
Wow! You finished all the quests you can do at your level!\r
Look! The below Know-How quests are available just for you. Check back often. You might find a surprise gift!
You know just about every Know-How there is to know! That doesn't mean you get to be a stranger though. I'm learning new things all the time!
Welcome to your new guide to Maple World. You have a new recommended quest. Check it out!
You already have a quest in progress. Click the quest title for more info.
You`ve completed Select quest. Check for available quests in the other tabs.
The quest's details are in the window on the right.\r\nDouble-click the character to find out where they are.
Welcome to your new guide to Maple World. You have a super important quest! Better check it out!
You're currently doing a quest. Complete them all to level up!
You`ve completed all required quest. Check for available quests in the other tabs.
You can find out about this super-important quest in the window on the right.\r\nDouble-click on the character to find out where they are.
Welcome to your new guide to Maple World. Welcome to your new guide to Maple World. Check out the list below!
You're currently doing a quest. Complete them all to level up!
You`ve already working on a Know-How quest. Click on the list below and follow the instructions!
All the info you need is in the window on the right.\r\nDouble-click on the character to find out where they are.
If you're ever wondering what to do at your current level, or if you need to figure out how to use an item or system, I'll be here to help you out.
You can press the button on the left of your screen or simply use the - hotkey to open Tot's Know How.
First of all, the Task tab will show you a list of available quests for your current level.\nEach of the three buttons displays a different quest list.
The Required button shows a list of quests that MUST be done at your current level.
These quests usually include job advancements and SP rewards, so don't miss out!
Recommended quests help you level up fast.
If you don't know what to do, click on the Recommended button, and follow the quests that are shown on that list.
You can click on any quest title to get more information on the right-hand screen.
Double-click on the NPC at the top of the screen to see where they are on the World Map.
You can also see the quest's objectives and rewards.
My Know-How quests will teach you various game systems and items with simple diagram and pictures.
There are also practice quests where you can get hands-on training, and some nice rewards.
Be sure to claim your gift when you complete level 20, 40, and 60 Know-How quests.\nJust click on the Tot's Gift button!

The icons next to each quest title display its current status. ! means the quest is available, O means the quest is currently in progress, and V means the quest has been completed. Is that easy or what?
You may see some quests called chain quests. These quests require you to complete other quests before you can take them.\nThe number in the ( ) shows how many quests there are total.
Didn't level-up from all those quests?\n That's okay, you can move to the next level with the click of a button!
You can use the "Replay" tab to review the Know-How's you've already learned.\nUse it whenever you need a refresher!
Just click on the Know-How you want to review, and you can take a whole new look.
That's it for the Tot's Know How!\r\nHit the Help button if you ever forget how to use it!
Did you know that you can change your keyboard controls any time you want?
Use the backslash key, or the game menu, to open the Change Hotkey window.
You can personalize your hotkeys by dragging any function icon to the key you desire.\nTry using skills, items, or emotes.
You can also restore the original hotkey settings by pressing the Default button.
When pressing the DEFAULT button, you can select between Basic Key Settings and Secondary Key Settings.
If you are a player that is used to the hotkeys of MapleStory, then select the Basic Key Setting.\nIt will switch back to the way they were when you first started the game.
If you wish to use hotkeys like in other games, you can select the Secondary Key Setting.
It will set the hotkeys in a way that are commonly used in many games.
Open up the Change Hotkey window and give it a try!\nPress the backslash key, or choose Key Setting from the System menu on the lower right.
You examined your key settings!\nMake yourself a keyboard layout that fits!
On top of using your skills on the fly, Quick Slots also let you use consumable items in the heat of battle.
You can quickly use food and potions to keep yourself alive and in the action.\nDon't get caught without a life saver!
If you want to map your Quick Slots to a different set of keys, press the Change Quick Slot button on the Key Settings window.
Select any Quick Slot, then press the key of your choice to map it.
I'll give you a potion to use.
Put it in your Hotkeys! It might just save the day.
I bet you're wondering what all those buttons on the left do.\nThose buttons will notify you of any featured quests or events that you can join.
The buttons are divided by quests, event quests, and contents.\nYou can get more details once you click on each of the buttons.\r\n
And you can hide all the icons by clicking on the triangle button on the left!
And you can hide it if it bothers you while hunting! And don't worry about your settings!\nIt will save the way you set it up!
I bet you're wondering what all those buttons on the left do.\nThose buttons will notify you of any featured quests or events that you can join.
They'll enable you to participate in events, accept quests, and even remotely complete some missions.
Make sure to check there if you're ever looking for something to do.
If you want to know more about a quest, press the Q key, or navigate to the Quest button from your menu.
The Quest window will display any quest you've accepted, sorted by region, on the left, and that quest's objectives on the right.
Make sure to pay close attention to the information on the right.\nThat way, you'll never get lost.
This window will show you objectives, levels, and rewards for any quest in your log.
The Quest window has a lot of other useful tools to keep you adventuring.\nYou can double-click on any NPC image to see where they are on the World Map.
You can even hit the Enable Navigation button to get a helpful pointer that will show you the way!
Use these tools to make your questing more enjoyable.
If you want to keep an eye on your quest progress, hit the Quest Helper button.
The Quest Helper will update automatically and display your objective all the way through to completion.
You can click on the small X button next to the quest name to remove it from the Quest Helper.
Let's take another look at the left menu on the Quest window.\nYour quests are organized by region.
This window has all sorts of information on what kinds of quests are available in your area, as well as where you might want to head next.
Any Required Quests and Event Quests are sorted separately, so you can always find them.
You can also see the names of quests that are available, in progress, completed, and recommended for your level, if you click the above tabs.
Use the Find NPC button to find quest-related characters more easily.
Now would be a great time to familiarize yourself with the Quest window and all of the helpful information it has to offer.
Press the Q key, or navigate to the Quest button from your menu.
I see you opened up your Quest Info window.\nUse the Quest Info window well. It should keep you flying through your adventures!
Are you tired of running all over the world to accept and complete quests?\nYou should try out one of the many quest items you can find in the Cash Shop!
Double-click on the item in your inventory to pull up a list of compatible quests.
Select the quest you want, then begin or complete the quest.\nIt's a real time-saver!
You can find these helpful items in the Quest Helpers section of the Time Savers category in the Cash Shop.
Here, I'll give you one to try for yourself.\nTry using the Quest Helper item in your inventory.
Have you tried using the Quest Helper?
You won't have to waste your time running around getting and completing quests if you take advantage of those items.
If you ever forget how to use a quest helper, check the Replay tab at any time to get a refresher.
Do you know how many interesting places there are in Maple World?\nIf you want to know, hit the W button to bring up the World Map!
The little bouncing arrow shows where you are right now.
You can hover over any location the map to see what kinds of monsters to expect, as well as a list of the NPC's that live in each town!
Place your cursor over any of the big blue dots to get a description of that map and any connecting areas.
If any area of the map lights up when you hover over it, that means you can click to explore a detailed map.
Don't be scared off by yellow dots! These mark maps outside of towns, but they'll provide the same sort of detailed information when you mouseover them.
You can right-click if you want to get back to the previous map.
Maple World isn't the only place you can look.\nClick the other Tab button.
The Star button will give you a look at the different sections of Maple World.
If you find the blinking distracting, you can turn it off at any time with the Quest button.
You can also search for NPC's or monsters using the text field on the right hand side of the World Map.
Now, open the World Map and get a good look!\nHit the W button to bring up the World Map!
Now you can read maps! Good work!\nUse that map to keep an eye on your surroundings, or to plan for your future travels!
If you ever have a question about how to use the World Map, check out the Replay tab!
Have you seen the Gift Box icon on the left side of the screen?
Press that button to bring up the Reward window.\nIt will show you any gifts you might have waiting for you at the moment.
Select an available gift and press Accept to move it into your inventory.
Have you seen the Gift Box icon on the left side of the screen?
Press that button to bring up the Reward window.\nIt will show you any gifts you might have waiting for you at the moment.
Select an available gift and press Accept to move it into your inventory.
If you were part of a Hot Time or Hot Day event, or are expecting another reward item, check for the Reward icon first!
If you're looking for a more convenient way to get between towns, I have the answer.\nTake a taxi!
If you're in a town on Victoria Island, you can hop between towns for just a few mesos by visiting the Taxi NPC.
You can use the NPC list next to your Minimap to find the Taxi.
You can also hit the Taxi button under Quick Move to get there fast.
If you ever forget how to find a taxi, check the Replay tab!
If you ever forget how to find a taxi, check the Replay tab!
Do you ever dream of taking a trip to a different continent?\nThe fastest way across the seas is by Ship or Airplane.
If you're on Victoria Island, head to the Six Path Crossway and climb the rope at the top to find the port.
If you're on any of the other continents, you can find a station in every major town.
Fares are different for every trip, and some of them even have specific time tables. Make sure you check before you try to head out!
If you get to a Ship early, you can usually depart after a brief wait.
If you're really in a time crunch, you can also rent an Airplane from Irvin.
Pay Irvin the fare, then press the Mount button on the Skill window to open up your Mount List.
Double-click on the Airplane to board, then go to the boarding station and pay the fare to begin your journey.
If you ever want to review your travel options, take a look at the Replay tab any time.
If you ever want to review your travel options, take a look at the Replay tab any time.
If you're tired of walking back and forth all the time, get yourself a Teleport Rock.
First up, go to a map you visit regularly\nDouble-click the Teleport Rock in your inventory.
Press the Register button to bookmark this map for later, then press the Move button to teleport back any time you want!
Towns will appear on the list automatically.\nSelect the town of your choice and hit Move.
But that's not all! Teleport Rocks are full of surprises.\nYou can also use it to meet up with a friend.
Enter a character's name and press the Move button to teleport there immediately!\nRemember, it only works if your friend is logged in!
You can find a Teleport Rock in the Cash Shop, within the Teleport Rocks section of the Time Savers category.
There are lots of different kinds of rocks with different functions, so make sure to find the one that's right for you!
I'll give you one to try out. I put it in the Cash tab of your inventory.
I hope it'll help you on your adventures!
I hope it'll help you on your adventures!
Do you ever find yourself looking for more out of your MapleStory experience?\nWhy not take a trip to the Cash Shop?\r\n
The fastest way into the Cash Shop is the ' key. You can also use the button on the bottom-right of the screen.
The Cash Shop is organized by the categories you'll see on the left to make it easier to navigate.
Click through the categories to get a feel for where everything is located.
Go on, take a look around!\nYou can purchase an item immediately with the Buy button, or use the shopping cart icon to save it to your Cart Inventory for a later purchase.
You can purchase an item immediately with the Buy button, or use the shopping cart icon to save it to your Cart Inventory for a later purchase.
You can purchase a present for another user by pressing the Gift icon.
Use the Star icon to register items in your Favorite menu.\nThat will let you find them much faster the next time you want to make a purchase.
And, if you want to show off what you're into, use the Like button to let other players know how great an item is.
Keep an eye out for items with lots of Likes. They're popular!
Any item you've previously Liked will be marked in orange. Press Like again to remove it.
Clicking on any item in your Favorite menu will display other items that are similar at the bottom.
Make sure to keep an eye out for package deals.\nHover over their icons to see what they include.
Couldn't find the item you wanted through the category menu?\nUse the Search function at the top-right of the Cash Shop screen.
You can find just about anything you need, even if you only know part of the name.
You can also sort by price, popularity, or specifc types of items. It's the most convenient way to find what you're looking for.
Anything you purchase from the Cash Shop will be placed in your account's Cash Inventory.\nAny character on your account can claim these items.
Before you can use it in-game, you will need to double-click on the item's icon in the Cash Shop to move it to a character.
Double-clicking some items, like Surprise Boxes, will consume them right away.
While you're shopping, make sure to keep an eye on any special sales in the top-right corner, or suggested items in the bottom row. You might just get a deal!
While you're shopping, make sure to keep an eye on any special sales in the top-right corner, or suggested items in the bottom row. You might just get a deal!
While you're shopping, make sure to keep an eye on any special sales in the top-right corner, or suggested items in the bottom row. You might just get a deal!
Why look like everyone else? The Cash Shop is full of great clothes and accessories to customize your Mapler.
Any items you buy will cover up the equipment you're currently wearing, but will not change your stats. It's just to make you look better!
There are plenty of unique styles available for every part of your character.\nJust check in the Cash Shop's Equipment category.
If you double-click on any item, you can see a preview of what it would look like on your character.\nPress the Attack and Move keys to strut your stuff!
You can also press the Buy Equipped Item button to purchase anything you are currently trying on.
Any equippable items you purchase will appear in your Equip inventory.\nDouble-click the item to equip.
You'll find that Cash equipment will show up in your Equipment window over your regular gear.
If you want to take off your cosmetic equipment, just double-click on its icon in the Equipment window.
Any equipment that was underneath your cosmetic item will show up, and your cash items will go back to your inventory's Equip tab.
I've got some limited-time cosmetic equipment for you to try out. Get out there and show off!
Find the items in the Equip tab of your inventory and put them on.
Hey, you look great! Enjoy!\nUse those items to stand out in Maple World and you'll be a star!
Remember picking out your face and hairstyle when you first started?
You can take those looks to the next level with Hair and Face Coupons from the Cash Shop!
Take a look at the Beauty Parlor section under the Appearance category in the Cash Shop.
You can double-click on any of the coupons to get a look at the different styles available.
Take a look in the Preview window to see how you look.
Each coupon will have instructions on where to go to get your stylish new appearance.\nJust check the item description.
See how easy it is to start looking your best?
If you can't find the surgeon or stylist you're looking for, use the QUICK MOVE menu to find the NPC.
Looking good has never been this fun!
I'll give you a coupon to get you started in the wonderful world of being adorable.\nThe coupon will have instructions on where to go to get your stylish new appearance.
Let's see how you do!
You look marvelous! What do you think?\nNew Hair and Face Coupons come out all the time, so keep an eye out for fresh new looks.
Did you notice that your Charm increased when you changed your looks?\nI bet you were wondering how that worked.\nCharm is one of your Character Traits.
Open the Production Skill window with the B key, or double-click your character to open the Character Info window, and press the My Traits button.
This window will give you an overview of your current traits, and let you track their progress.
Traits are passive stats that will increase whenever you perform certain actions. Mouseover any trait to see its stats, your progress for that day, and the benefits of leveling up.
Why don't I give you some now?\nUse the item, then open the Production Skill window with the B key to see what you got!
Did you check out the Traits window?\nIt's good to diversify the time you spend playing MapleStory. The rewards are worth it!
Let's talk about medals, those titles you see floating under peoples' names.
You'll get medals for quests, events... really all sorts of things.\nAny medals you get will show up in the Equip tab of your inventory.
You can double-click a medal to equip it, just like other equipment.\nYou should see the medal's name and graphic below your name.
Medals all come with different stats and bonuses for your character.
Make sure to keep an eye out for medals that boost your important stats! They can really make a difference.
Press the ; key to open the Medal window, where you can see a list of every medal you've earned.
Mouseover any medal to get a look at its stats and see when you first acquired it.
When you have a good collection, you'll probably want to use the Sort button to organize them all.
Some medals have an expiration date, but you can use the Reissue button on the Medal window to renew your medal.
Be warned, you can only reissue medals 100 times, and the price to reissue goes up each time.
Think carefully before you start reissuing medals all willy-nilly!
You may also notice information on the medals you can acquire when you look at the Medal window.
Medals related to your character's class will show up on the Job tab, whereas the General tab will show off various situational medals.
You don't have to take on any challenges to get the medals.\nJust meet the listed conditions.
If you want to keep track of your progress on a particular medal, press the Attempt button on the Challenges tab.\r\n
Talk to Dalair in any town to take on different medal challenges.
I'm going to give you a medal for being such a stellar pupil. Try equipping it now.\nJust double-click the medal in the Equip tab of your inventory!
You're all medaled up.\nTry to get all the medals you can! They're super helpful.
Check the Replay tab if you ever need a refresher on medals.
Do you ever feel the need to tell the world what you're thinking?\nOr maybe you're just looking for a bigger audience to sell your wares?
Megaphones can send messages to lots of people at once!
Double-click on a Megaphone, type in your message, and hit OK to send it out to your viewers.
You can put items you're trying to sell into the Megaphone to show them off.
If you click on an item name in someone else's message, you can view its details and whisper to the seller for faster trading.
One Megaphone even lets you include an image with your message, showing it off in the Chat window AND on-screen. It's a real eye-catcher.
You can check out all the Megaphones on sale in the Megaphones section of the Social category in the Cash Shop.\r\n\r\n
Each Megaphone has a specific function and targets different players.\nMake sure to find the one that's right for you!
Why don't you try out this Megaphone now?\nDouble-click on the Megaphone in the Cash tab of your inventory and make yourself heard.\r\n
That was loud! Pretty helpful, huh?\nI hope you make a lot of friends by using Megaphone items to communicate with numerous other players!
Having trouble taking down a nasty monster by yourself? Or just getting lonely?
Try using the party system! With a group of like-minded adventurers by your side, you can do anything!
There are all sorts of ways to form a party with other Maplers.\nLet's begin by learning how to start your own party!
Begin by opening the Maple User List & Guild Window.\nPress the P key to see the Party Tab.
Click Create, and a new party will form with you as the leader.
There are lots of ways to invite other Maplers into you party.
You can open up chat and type '/party name' or you could right-click on the Mapler when they're nearby and click Party Invite.\r\n
You could also press the P key to bring up the window.\nIf you click the Invite button, you can enter the name of the Mapler you want to adventure with.
If you're not sure who you're looking for, click the Search button in the Party Tab of the Maple User List & Guild Window or call up the Party Search Window with the O key.\r\n
Check out the Find Members Tab in the Party Search Window.
You can look up the name, job, and level of any Maplers on the same map or channel as you, then invite whomever you want to your party.
You can also find someone else's party from the Party Search Window, in case you don't want to make your own.\r\n
You can see which parties that are on the same map or channel as you, and can ask to join them with the Apply button.
Find parties in your level range with the View Similar Levels button.
If you already have a party and want to let others find and request to join you, check the Allow Party Request option.
Find parties in your level range with the View Similar Levels button.
You can Replay this guide whenever you want a refresher on parties.
Is your inventory so full of junk that you can't pick up any new junk?\nDo you have some valuable item that you don't need right now, but might need later?
Try leaving your extra items with the Storage Keepers located in every town!
Not only can you store items, but some items can even be shared with your other characters in the same world.
Double-click a Storage Keeper to check out your storage space.
You can make sure your old items are still there, or take items in and out as needed by double-clicking them.
You can even deposit and withdraw Mesos by pressing the Meso icon.
Storing items cost a small fee, but withdrawing them is free.\nStorage Keepers have to make a living somehow, right?
Why don't you visit a Storage Keeper Scrooge now to see how it works?\nFind a Scrooge in Free Market (or by checking the World Map if you aren't in town).
You opened the storage window!\nIsn't it a great way to keep your important items safe?
Don't you ever wish you had more room in your inventory for pig heads, squishy liquid, and other goodies?
You can get more inventory space by double-clicking the Inventory Expansion Coupon in your Inventory Window!
Inventory Expansion Coupons are available in the Cash Shop.\nYou can also get them after your Job Advancement.
Check out Inventory Slots under the Character Modifications section of the Cash Shop.\nThere are coupons for each Inventory Tab.
Unlike other Inventory Expansion Coupons, the coupons you get from the Cash Shop will expand your inventory right away, without having to be used first!\r\n
If you're in a big hurry, you can just click one of the Slot buttons in the lower-right of the Cash Shop to get more inventory space.
Of course, it will cost you as much as purchasing a coupon!
Since you're such a good listener, here's an Inventory Expansion Coupon.\nOpen the Use Tab of your inventory and use the Inventory Expansion Coupon I gave you.
You used the Inventory Expansion Coupon!\nOf course, it's best to keep your inventory neat and tidy, so that there's always space for your rewards.\r\n
Have you seen other adventurers with adorable pet companions?\nThey aren't just cute--they also have cool functions and abilities to help you out.\r\n
Summoning and dismissing a pet is easy: just double-click it in your Inventory.
A summoned pet will have Item Pouch and Meso Magnet functions by default. You can also equip it with skills to help you out.
These items will let your pet do things like give you a power boost, or feed you potions while you're fighting.
Pet Skills can be equipped by double-clicking them from the Cash tab of the inventory.
To see what skills a pet has equipped, check the Pet tab of the Equip Window (use the E key to open it).
Remember, some pets are only effective when they have the right items or skills equipped in the right slot at the same time!
If you want to check out your summoned pet's details, double-click on it.
You can see the pet's name, equipped items, level, how close it feels to you, and how full it is with the Pet Info Button in the Character Info Window.
Feed your pet Pet Food to keep it full.\nDouble-click the Pet Food in your inventory to feed your pet. This will make the pet more full, and it will like you a little more.

Pet Merchants sell Pet Food, of course.
If you feed your pet exclusive NX Pet Food for that pet type, then it will be completely satisfied and like you much more.
If your pet gets too hungry, it'll be unhappy with you and eventually it'll be dismissed. Keep your pet well fed!\r\n
You can also talk to your pet to make it like you more.
Give it commands, like 'sit,' in the chat window to see your pet's reactions.\nThe more it likes you, the more responses it can give you!
You can get a Pet Command Guide from a Pet Merchant to see what commands you can give your pet.\r\n
As your pet levels up, it can also respond to more commands. The likelihood that it will obey will also increase.
You can meet many special pets in the Pet section of the Cash Shop.
You'll also find the equipment and food a pet can use in the Pet Use and Pet Food sections of the Pet category.
If you want to really set your pet apart, get it a nice accessory in the Pet Appearance section.\r\n
Wouldn't you love a furry (or scaly) companion to keep you company on your adventures?\nTry using the Puffram's Cloud Candy item in your inventory.
And don't forget that you can summon your pet by double-clicking it in the Cash tab of your Inventory!
Keep your pet well fed and well groomed, and it'll help you every step of the way!
You used your pet food! Well done!\nI hope you and your pet become best friends!
If you want to get around Maple World REALLY fast, you'd better get a mount!!\nFrom the back of a mount, you'll get boosts to Speed and Defense.\r\n
Mounts are often given out during events, but you can also get them from the Cash Shop's Gachapon.
If you have a Mount Coupon, double-click it on the Use tab of the Inventory.\nYou'll gain a skill to ride your new mount!
You can use your new mount skill by pressing the K key or Mount button after selecting Skills from the menu on the lower right of the screen.
Right-click the mount icon at the upper-right corner of the screen to dismount.
You can't fight from the back of your mount, so remember how to get off in a hurry if you get mobbed by monsters!
Why don't I give you a mount so you can try it out?\nJust use the Mount Coupon in your Use Inventory to try it out.
You have to double-click on the Mount icon in your Skills Window to ride.
You've used the Mount! Well done!\nIf you ever need a refresher on mounts, just Replay this guide!\r\n
There are all kinds of mounts out there. Find the one that suits you and explore Maple World!\r\n
If you find yourself playing with the same adventurers all the time, why not add them to your Buddy List so you can always get in touch!
You can see all your registered buddies at a glance.\nYou can also easily do all kinds of things with your buddies.
Just press the P key or select the Buddy tab under the Maple User List Window to pull up your Buddy List.
To add a buddy, click the Add button in the Buddy Tab and enter the name of your friend.
You and your friend will be added to each other's Buddy Lists after they accept your request.
There are many things you can do with a registered buddy, such as inviting them to a party or whispering to them.
You can also block or delete friends on the list.
If you have several friends on the list, you can sort them into groups to make it easier to view and manage your friends.
Try clicking on the Buddy List+ button if your buddy list is full.\nFor a few Mesos, he'll expand your Buddy List.
Why don't you take a look at the Buddy List for yourself? Open the Maple User List & Guild Window with the R key or choose Community from your Menu on the lower-right corner of the screen.
You took a look at the Buddy List window!\nI hope you add lots of buddies and have a grand old time in Maple World!
If one Mapler is heroic, and two are dynamic, imagine what a whole group of them can do!\r\n
That's what guilds are all about! \nJoining forces to do the impossible...or just have a good time!
The guild system will let you join forces with a diverse group of adventurers.
Anyone who's Lv. 100 or higher can create a guild.\nFind Lea in any town and ask her to take you to the Hall of Heroes.
Heracle is waiting for you there, and for some mesos he'll let you make a guild on the spot.
Press the Guild Hotkey to view current guild information.
From that window, you can manage your guild and its members.
First, you can check the contributions of each guild member.\nYou can obtain GP based on your contributions. GP is very important because it is used for Honor EXP and Guild Skills!
Press the Guild Skills button to see all the guild skills available to you.\nYou should take the time to learn them.
You can use GP and IGP to level up Guild Skills that can be used by all guild members!
GP is for skills that affect all guild members, and IGP is for skills that affect individuals.
Hover your mouse over a skill name for more detailed info.\nMake sure you know what a skill does before you raise its level!
Work together to level up all the very necessary skills for your guild!
There are all sorts of positions in a guild.\nYou can change each position's name if you want.
Press the gear button to manage the guild.\nEnter unique names for each position, then press Save.
Give your guild members the zany and far-out positions that they deserve!
In the Guild Window, you can also sort by various categories.
Press the triangular button to sort members by their level, position, and contributions.\nSee who's at the top and who can use some help.
You can also search guilds before making one of your one.\r\n
Open the Guild UI without being a member of a guild and press the Search Guild button.\nYou can search for guilds in various ways.
Take a look at the Guild Window for yourself.\nJust press the G key or open the Guild tab from the Maple User List & Guild UI.
You opened the Guild Window! Good work!\nNow start saving your mesos and visit Heracle to create your guild.
If you need a refresher on guilds, just replay this guide.\r\n
After you reach Lv. 30, you can learn a profession and gain special non-combat skills.\nProfessions let you craft your own equipment, accessories, and potions.
To learn a profession, you'll need to go to the town of Ardentmill.
Ardentmill is connected to all the other towns through a portal.\nYou can also use Quick Move to get to Ardentmill in a flash!
There is a master of every profession living in Ardentmill.\nTo begin with, you'll need to learn either Mining or Harvesting.
Based on which one you choose, you'll be able to craft different types of items.
Go to the lower-right of Ardentmill.\nCole can teach you Mining, while Saffron can teach you Harvesting.
These skills will let you dig up ores or pick herbs that you find while wandering around Maple World.
If you have a pickaxe or shovel in your inventory, you can press the space bar near an ore or herb to collect it.
The items you gather like this can be used to craft items, so keep them safe!
Once you've learned Mining or Harvesting, it's time to learn how to craft!\nThe masters of Ardentmill can teach you Smithing, Accessory Crafting, and Alchemy.
Keep in mind that you can only learn 1 gathering profession and 1 crafting profession!
After you've learned a crafting profession, it's time to make your own items.\nOpen the Production Skill Window with the B key.
Your profession levels and traits will display on the first page.\nYour gathering and crafting skills will each get their own tab.
Clicking the tab will show you that profession's level, fatigue, and mastery.
If you run out of fatigue, you can't use your profession skills for the rest of the day. Keep that in mind!
Once your profession's mastery fills up, you'll gain a level in that profession.
A list of recipes for each profession shows up to the left of the Production Window.
If you click the Available Recipes button, you'll see what recipes you can make right now.
Click on each recipe's name to see what items you'll need and what the recipe will make.
Press the Craft button, and your item will be crafted after some time.\nCrafted items are then moved to your inventory.
Shall we take a look at the production window?\nPress the B key to open the Production Skill Window.\nGo ahead and take a look!
You opened the Production Skill Window.\nIf you ever have trouble finding a particular item, you can craft it for yourself!
Keep your eyes peeled for valuable materials you find on the road.\nIf you want a refresher on professions, you can always replay this guide.
Lv. 30 characters can be turned into cards, which can be equipped on other characters for added benefit.\nThis is called the Character Card System.
Different classes give you different boosts, from increased Attack to Defense to HP or MP!\nShare these boosts with all of your characters through the Character Card System.
You can equip Character Cards on the character selection window.\nTry clicking the Character Card button in the character selection screen.
You'll see all of your Lv. 30+ characters as cards!
The rank of each card is based on the character's level.\nThe higher the better, and higher ranks mean bigger stat boosts.
Hover your mouse over a card to see what kind of boosts it will give you when you equip it.
You can see all the bonuses from your current cards under Effects on the right.
Clicking on a Character Card will put it in an empty slot on your equipped deck.
When you want to unequip a card from your deck, simply click on it again.
However, you cannot equip more than 1 card of the same job on a single Card Deck.
You can get bonus effects by equipping 3 cards of the same overall class or 3 cards that are S rank or higher.
Give Character Cards a shot. You won't be disappointed!
You can get bonus effects by equipping 3 cards of the same overall class or 3 cards that are S rank or higher.
Give Character Cards a shot. You won't be disappointed!
You can get bonus effects by equipping 3 cards of the same overall class or 3 cards that are S rank or higher.
Give Character Cards a shot.\nYou won't be disappointed!
Lv. 30+ characters can take on Part-Time Jobs.

Just because you're logged off, that doesn't mean your characters get to relax.
Put them to work gaining EXP, scrolls, equipment, and more!
You can start a Part-Time Job from the character selection screen.
Click the Part-Time Job Button, then select Start Part-Time Job and choose the character you want to put to work.\r\n
Only your Lv. 50+ characters will show up on the list.\nAfter choosing a character, pick a job and hit the Select button to begin.
You must let your character work for at least 1 hour to get the reward.\nYou can do a Part-Time Job for up to 6 hours total.
A clock icon will show up above the character who's on a Part-Time Job.
After a character finishes a Part-Time Job, a gift box will appear over their head until you collect the reward.
After working at it for 2 hours, your part-timer will start to earn special rewards.
You can see how along your character is by checking the timer above their head.
After 1 hour of working at a Part-Time Job, you can press Reward to get your...well, reward.
After that, just log in and talk to Ms. Appropriation in town.\nIf you're in a hurry, you can use the Quick Move feature to go straight to Ms. Appropriation.
Your reward will then be placed straight into your inventory.\nReap the benefits of your characters' hard work!
Your reward will then be placed straight into your inventory.\nReap the benefits of your characters' hard work!
Your reward will then be placed straight into your inventory.\nReap the benefits of your characters' hard work!
As you level up, you'll gain a whole bucket-full of skills.\nHow will you be able to use them all?

Easy! Just use Macros!
You'll find the Macro Button in your Skills Window.
Macros let you use up to 3 skills with a single hotkey press.
In the Skill Window, drag and drop your skills into the Macro slots to register your Macro skills.
You can even assign a name to the Macro skill so that you remember which is which.
For added style, your character will shout out the Macro's name whenever you use it!
Go ahead and open your Skill Window so you get what I'm talking about.
It's easy to open the Skill Window with the K key, but you can also find your Skill Window by clicking the Menu Button at the bottom of the screen.\r\n
Do you get Macros now? Huh?\nI can't wait to see all the cool Macros you'll come up with! Be sure to show them off every chance you get!
You should check out the Dimensional Mirror in each town.\nIf you're in town, just use the Quick Move feature and click the Dimensional Mirror button.
This magical mirror will warp you to Party Quests and event maps.
If you hover a mouse over the map icons in the Dimensional Mirror Window, you can see a simple description of that map.
Take a look at the level requirement, difficulty, and reward to figure out which maps to try.
Why don't you go peek at the Dimensional Mirror to see what kind of maps are available?
Go to town and find the Dimensional Mirror.\nUse Quick Move to find it!
Did you see all the crazy places the Dimensional Mirror can take you?
The more you level up, the more you'll end up using the Dimensional Mirror!
Do you ever want to trade items with other adventurers?
You can right-click on another adventurer and click Trade or type '/trade username' in the chat window to begin a trade.
Use the Trade Window that pops up to trade your items.
Drag and drop the items you want to trade into the Trade Window.\nYou can even trade some mesos by using the meso icon.
Warning! Once you put an item in, you can only take it out by closing the Trade Window.
Once you've put up all the items you want to trade, click the Trade button.\nAfter the other adventurer also hits the Trade button, the trade will be complete.
If you ever forget this whole process, feel free to replay this guide!
Have some goods to sell? Looking to pick up some discount potions? Why not try the Free Market?
There's a portal to the Free Market in every town. If you're in a super hurry, you can reach the Free Market from the Quick Move menu.\r\n
Adventurers from all over Maple World gather in Free Markets to buy and sell items at their shops.
Double-click on a store to see what that store is buying or selling.
You can also see other adventurers who are browsing the store and chat with them.
If you take your time to browse the stalls, you'll find whatever you need. Probably.
You don't have to spend hours asking around for the deal after, either! It's all on display in the Free Market!
The Free Market sure is convenient, but it can be overwhelming with all the different stalls!
If you ever need help sorting through it all, why not try using the Owl of Minerva?
The Owl of Minerva lets you search for your item by name and filter your search with various conditions.
Double-click on the Owl of Minerva from your inventory to use it right away.
The results of your search will show up in the window.
As soon as your results are displayed, the Owl of Minerva item will be used up.
You can sort the results to help you find the specific item you want at the price you want.\r\n
You can purchase the Owl of Minerva from the Free Market section of the Cash Shop.
Try using it at the Free Market to wheel and deal at the speed of owls!
If you ever forget how to use the Owl of Minerva, just check the Replay tab whenever you want.\r\n
If you want to sell items on the Free Market, you need a Hired Merchant permit.
With your permit in hand, go into one of the Free Market rooms and find a vacant lot.
Double-click on the Hired Merchant permit in your inventory to open up a store.
You need a vacant lot to open a stall.\nIf there aren't any, try another room.\r\n
After using the permit, the Hired Merchant Window will appear and you can set up your items and sales prices.
After entering your store's name, make a list of items you wish to sell and purchase.
Once the store is open, other adventurers will visit your store and buy your items.
This convenient Hired Merchant permit can be bought from the Free Market category of the Cash Shop.
There are two types of Hired Merchant permits: one that makes you stay online to sell items, and one that sells items even when you're offline.
Choose whichever permit works best for you!
This convenient Hired Merchant permit can be bought from the Free Market category of the Cash Shop.
There are two types of Hired Merchant permits: one that makes you stay online to sell items, and one that sells items even when you're offline.
Choose whichever permit works best for you!
This convenient Hired Merchant permit can be bought from the Free Market category of the Cash Shop.
There are two types of Hired Merchant permits: one that makes you stay online to sell items, and one that sells items even when you're offline.
Choose whichever permit works best for you!
Do you have any equipment with Potential that just doesn't do it for you?\nWhat you need is a Miracle Cube!
A Miracle Cube can be used to randomly change an item's Potential.\nYou might even get a higher rank Potential if you're lucky!
Double-click a Miracle Cube in your Inventory and click the equipment you want to use it on!
The results UI will show you how the Potentials have changed.
Miracle Cubes are in the Equipment Modifications category of the Cash Shop.
While most Miracle Cubes will only change the existing Potential, there are some that imbue extra Potential on top of the existing Potential.\r\n
Pick the kind of Miracle Cube you need and give it a try!
Here's a Miracle Cube for you to try.\nOpen the Cash tab of your inventory and double-click on the Miracle Cube to use it. Easy, right?
Well? How'd it turn out?\nI hope you're happy with the results!\nIf you ever forget how to use a Miracle Cube, just use the Replay tab!
How'd you like to have a monster on YOUR side for once?\nYou'd better get a Familiar, then!
After becoming your Familiars, monsters will join you on your Maple World adventure.
Having a Familiar at your side gives you bonus stats, and the Familiar fights enemies with you!
To get a Familiar, you have to get a Familiar Card by defeating the monster you want.\nUse that card to add the Familiar to your Monster Book.
You can open the Monster Book with the N key and see what Familiars you have at a glance.
Double-click on a Familiar in the Monster book to summon it.
The red marble over the Familiar's head is its vitality.\nIf it runs out of vitality, the summon will be canceled.
When the Familiar is put away, its vitality will recover over time automatically.
Now open the Monster Book.\nYou can open the Monster Book with the N key.
You opened the Monster Book!\nRemember, Familiars aren't just for show. They'll help you mush your enemies' faces into the ground!
If you ever want a refresher on Familiars, just check out the Replay tab.
Wouldn't it be fun to have a people-sized companion for all your Maple adventures?\nIf you said yes, you should get an Android!
Androids are your true companions.\nThey'll say hi when you log in and cheer you on through all your trials and tribulations.\r\n
You can create an Android using Smithing profession skills.
Some boss monsters will drop the blueprint for an Android, but you can also get it from different events.
If you're not an expert in Smithing, you can also get an Android directly from another user, or from the Free Market.
If you're not an expert in Smithing, you can also get an Android directly from another user, or from the Free Market.
Just remember, Androids will not work if you don't have a Mechanical Heart for it to use.
Smithing professionals can create a Mechanical Heart, but it has a specific trading time.
Much like your character, you can change your Android's looks; down to hair, face, and equipment.
The Android Beautician in Henesys will help you get your Android looking its best, if you have the right Coupons.
Androids can equip a variety of cosmetic items from the Cash Shop as well.
Check the Replay tab if you ever need advice on Androids!
Check the Replay tab if you ever need advice on Androids!
I don't know about you, but I love opening presents.\nAnything could be inside!
Gachapon are like that too.\nThey're your mysterious ticket to fun.
All you have to do is take a Gachapon Ticket to Gachapierrot in any town.
Press the Start button on the Gachapon window for a chance at a random item.
The list on the right will show you any Gachapon you've acquired for the day.\nIf you're lucky, you might just get an exceedingly rare item. Keep at it!
You can find Gachapon Tickets in various quantities in the Gachapon Tickets section of the Random Rewards category in the Cash Shop.
Remote Gachapon Tickets are an even more convenient way to get your items, since you won't even have to find Gachapierrot to use them. \r\n
I'll give you a Gachapon Ticket to try out.\nVisit Gachapierrot in any town, and give it a try!
Did you use your Gachapon ticket? Surprises are the best!\nKeep Gachaponing until you get what you want.
Have you found the soul mate you want to spend the rest of your life with?\nOnly one thing to do... get married!
You can use a Wedding Ticket to create the ceremony of a lifetime.
But if you want to get married, you must get engaged first.
Only male characters can create an Engagement Ring.\nTalk to Moony the Wedding Jeweler in Amoria to start the Engagement Ring quest.\r\n
Once you have it, double-click on the Engagement Ring in your Use tab, and enter the character ID of your future spouse.
If they accept your proposal, both of you will share the ring and your characters will be Engaged.
Whatever you do, don't lose the ring.\nThe engagement will be called off!
Once you're engaged, purchase a Wedding Ticket from the Cash Shop.\nThere are a variety of different wedding packages, so look closely before you buy.
I know you'll find the wedding for you!
Once you're ready to get hitched, form a party with your future spouse.\nHead to Amoria and let Assistant Nicole that you are ready to tie the knot.
Head to Amoria and let Assistant Nicole that you are ready to tie the knot.
Once you enter the Wedding Hall, a message will appear in your guests' Chat window to let them know it's starting.
Everybody will start showing up shortly afterwards.
You and your guests will enjoy a lovely ceremony and then you'll be married!\nAfter the wedding, talk to Angelique to get your rings and presents.
If you go to your Character Info window, you'll see a heart mark on the left.\nThat means you're married!
Don't be afraid to take the bonds of matrimony with the one you love.
If you ever get lost during the marriage process, you can go to the Replay tab to get another look at this information.
Don't be afraid to take the bonds of matrimony with the one you love.
If you ever get lost during the marriage process, you can go to the Replay tab to get another look at this information.
Don't be afraid to take the bonds of matrimony with the one you love.
If you ever get lost during the marriage process, you can go to the Replay tab to get another look at this information.
It can be fun chatting with random people.\nMapleStory has a whole system for it!
Press the Maple Chat hotkey to open the UI.
You can have fun conversations with Maplers from all over, or with your friends!
You can also see the other party's information or add them as friends.
Press the heart button to give Likability points. Maplers with higher Likability will be shown in the first pages of the Maple Chat UI.
If you ever need a break, why don't you try striking up a nice chat in Maple Chat?
Now open Maple Chat yourself!
You can explore its many functions and see which Mapler has had the best Likability this week!
You opened Maple Chat! Good work!
If you ever need a break, why don't you try striking up a nice chat in Maple Chat?
Just gained a level and not sure what to do?\nLet the Maple Guide and the Content Map help you out!
Press the U key to bring up the Maple Guide. Based on your current level, the guide will show you the main quests available to you, as well as the best fields for gaining experience.
Click on a field in the guide to be transported straight to it!
The guide won't just help you find fields, either.\nIt will suggest good Theme Dungeons and Party Quests for leveling up, too!
You can also see information on other level ranges by pressing U again or clicking the + button next to the close button.
So, in addition to showing you content for your current level, the guide can display all content by level range! Just scroll the list up and down with your mouse wheel.
Click on the button for a particular area to get detailed reward information about it.\nThis window also contains a button to move you directly to that area.
Why not open up the Maple Guide right now and take a look?\nWith the Maple Guide, you never have to feel lost ever again!
Why not open up the Maple Guide right now and take a look?\nWith the Maple Guide, you never have to feel lost ever again!
Have you found some awesome equipment with 'hidden potential'?
Potentials are additional stats that equipment can have in addition to their normal stats. If you find the right ones, they can make you very powerful!
To uncover these hidden potentials, use the Magnifying Glass icon in your inventory.
First click on the Magnifying Glass icon, then click on the equipment that has hidden potential. This will cost you some mesos, depending on the level of the equipment.
Equipment can have different grades, which determine the type and value of the revealed potential.
The higher the grade, the higher the potential value.
In MapleStory, the equipment grades are Rare, Epic, Unique and Legendary, with Legendary being the best. Everyone dreams of finding Legendary gear someday!
If you don't like the random potential you get, you can always reset it with cubes.\nI'll explain more about those later.
Most pieces of equipment don't have potential.\nIf you have a really good piece of gear with no potential, you can add it by using a Potential Scroll.
Hang on... I think I have an old Potential Scroll... Yep!\nHere it is. Go on, try it out on a piece of your equipment.
I bet you feel more powerful already! Neat, right?
Potentials are not the only way to make your equipment stronger.\nTake a look at this item. It was powered up by a Nebulite!
How can you get Nebulites?\nBy hunting monsters, of course!
Every once in awhile, you'll see a box like this drop.\nInside will be a Nebulite with a random grade and stats.
That's right, Nebulites have grades too! \nThey range from A to D. The higher the grade, the stronger the stats.
So, how do you use a Nebulite?\nI'll tell you right now!
First, you need an Nebulite Socket Creator from the General Store in any of the towns.\nUse the Socket Creator to drill a new socket into your chosen piece of equipment.
Then, you can just drop the Nebulite into the socket! Presto!
You can also remove a Nebulite from your equipment if you want to put a different one in.\nAll you need is a Nebulite Diffuser from the Cash Shop.
Just be aware that the Nebulite Diffuser destroys the Nebulite it removes!
If you find Nebulites that you don't want, you can always trade them to other adventurers.\nHowever, you might want to collect them to use with Nebulite Fusion.
Check your initial skills in the skill window. Everyone should have a skill called Nebulite Fusion.
This skill can be used to take unwanted Nebulites and exchange them for new ones.
Note that you'll need a Premium Fusion Ticket from the Cash Shop if you want to fuse Nebulites that are B grade or better!
Here, I'll give you a Nebulite box.\nThat way you can have one to try out.
Here, I'll give you a Nebulite box.\nThat way you can have one to try out.
So, even after potentials and Nebulites, you want to make your equipment even stronger, right?
Well, you can do that! It's called Bonus Potential and it's another set of bonus stats under your potentials.
Bonus Potential can be added to equipment the same way you would add regular potential.
Just use a Bonus Potential Scroll on a piece of equipment that does not have Bonus Potential.
Now, here's the important part!\nYou can ONLY give Bonus Potential to equipment that already has regular potential!
Then, use the Magnifying Glass to see what type of Bonus Potential got.
You can also change the Bonus Potential if you don't like it.
You just need a Bonus Potential Cube, found in the Cash Shop where the Red and Black Cubes are sold.
If you want to reach the very peak of power, you'll need more than just potential.\nFind the right Bonus Potential for you!
If you want to reach the very peak of power, you'll need more than just potential.\nFind the right Bonus Potential for you!
Imagine a weapon as strong as the terrifying bosses of Maple World. Sounds impressive, right?\nWell, you don't have to imagine anymore!
Let me explain how to make your weapon into a Soul Weapon.
If you want to turn a weapon into a Soul Weapon, you'll need a Soul Enchanter.\nThere's a small chance to find them when defeating monsters.
All you have to do is double-click on the Soul Enchanter and then click on the item you want to turn into a Soul Weapon.
However, not all Soul Enchanters have the same success rate, so you might need to try a few before you get your weapon made!
Keep in mind that Soul Weapons can only be made from weapons Lv. 75 and above.\nCheck your levels before you make plans!
When you succeed, you'll see that the Soul Weapon's information in the tool tip is empty.
You'll also get a cool effect over you head. The next step is to fill your Soul Weapon with the souls of awesome monsters!
Usually only the stronger bosses have souls, but they're not just going to hand them over to you.
You'll have to collect Soul Shards, and then trade 10 of them in for 1 random soul.
Souls are graded by their stats.\nThe best ones, which also happen to be the rarest ones, are the Magnificent Souls.
Every time you defeat a monster, you'll see your Soul Gauge charge up.
Once the gauge is fully charged, you'll see some REAL fireworks!
A full gauge lets use the special skills of the bosses whose souls you have!\nThese skills can be seen in the initial skill window when a Soul Weapon is equipped.
Some bosses will appear and fight along with you for a short time.\nOthers can help you in critical situations.
All of them should be of great help.
Talk to the Mysterious Magician if you want to change you Soul Weapon back into a normal one.\nHe's there to help you.
Try using a Soul Enchanter on a weapon of yours.\nIf you're successful, you'll be well on your way to mastering Soul Weapons!
Go forth, and claim the souls of your foes! Hooray!
Everyone loves seeing those giant damage numbers popping out of their enemies.\nDid you know that you can use Damage Skins to make those numbers look even cooler?
You'll need a Damage Skin Coupon to get a new Damage Skin.\nThey can be obtained from some quests, events, and the Cash Shop.
If you have a Damage Skin Coupon, then you should give it a try!\nThey can make your fights look super cool.
Earned Damage Skins can be stored, changed, and used whenever you want.\nYour current and stored Damage Skins can be viewed in the Character Info window.
You can store up to 30, and it only costs 100,000 mesos to switch them out.
Want to give it a try?\nHere, have a Damage Skin Coupon!\nI wouldn't want you to feel left out, after all.
Aren't Damage Skins cool?\nSee how many you can collect!
Have you ever clicked on this cute little square in your inventory?
This will take you to the Bits window, and I bet you're wondering what that means.
Bits are little pieces of pictures that grant you small bonuses.\nIf you collect an entire set, you can see the picture they make!
Just remember, your Bits are in your inventory, not your Equip window.
You'll need a Bit-Case to store your Bits in. Different Bit-Cases can hold different amounts of Bits.\nYou can only use one at a time, so look out for ones that hold more Bits.
They're also Set-Up items, so be sure to drag the Bit-Case you want to use from there to your Bits window.
Please use the arrow button on the right to open the Bit-Case you currently have equipped.
Of course, you'll need to find Bits to fill your Bit-Case with.\nBits are given out in special gift boxes.
Double-click to open the boxes, and then find your new Bits in your Bits inventory.
Double-click on the Bits you want to equip, and they'll go into your Bit-Case.\nIf you can find the whole set, you'll see the completed picture.
Most Bits are given out as part of an event, so be on the lookout for those!
Try opening the Bit-Box that I gave you.\nOh, and here's a Bit-Case, too. Have fun!
Try opening the Bit-Box that I gave you.\nOh, and here's a Bit-Case, too. Have fun!
Nobody likes losing EXP when they get KO'd, right?\nWell, there's a way you can avoid that little penalty.
We have these items called Safety Charms.\nYou can buy them for mesos from Matilda in each town.
If you have one in your inventory when you get KO'd, one will be used automatically and save your EXP!
I'll give you one Safety Charm right now. I hope you won't need it anytime soon.
I'll give you one Safety Charm right now. I hope you won't need it anytime soon.
One of the worst parts of being KO'd is having to return to a Safety Zone.
If you want to get back to where you fell, you have to go alllllllll the way back, right?\nAgain, there's a way around this.
Matilda in all the towns sells an item called a Respawn Token.\nThis special token can revive you right where you got KO'd!
If you have one in your inventory when you go down, it'll ask if you want to use it.\nYou can only use each one once, but it can save you a lot of time.
Here, have a Respawn Token on me.\nTry to save it for a really rough situation.
Here, have a Respawn Token on me.\nTry to save it for a really rough situation.
Wow, look at you! Made it all the way to your 4th Job Advancement, huh?\nThat means you have all the skills for your job... but your training doesn't end here.
If you want to push your skills further, you'll need Mastery Books.
Mastery Books can increase the Master Level for 4th Job Advancement skills that have reached their normal limit.
You can keep making your skills stronger and stronger!
You can purchase Mastery Books with mesos from the General Store in any town.
There are two kinds, Lv. 20 and Lv. 30 books. You can use the Lv. 20 books up to Mastery Level 20, and after that you'll need the Lv. 30 books. Make sure you get the right one!
Remember, you can keep getting stronger as long as you want!
Remember, you can keep getting stronger as long as you want!
Have you been wondering what those cards that drop from monsters are?
These are collectible cards that are added to your Crusader Codex.\nPress the N key to see your collection.
If you have a monster's card, you can see detailed information like where the monster appears and what items the monster drops.
The Crusader Codex is full of useful information, and collecting cards can be a lot of fun.\nSee how many you can find!
The Crusader Codex is full of useful information, and collecting cards can be a lot of fun.\nSee how many you can find!
If you ever find yourself needing a makeover, there are plenty of hair and face coupons to help spice things up.
And don't worry about losing your old style, as long as you're using the Beauty Salon.
Press the E key to open your Equip window.\nClick on the button that says SALON to open the Beauty Salon window.
You can store your hairs and faces in the Beauty Salon, or use the preview function to try on your stored styles.
Making changes through the Beauty Salon only costs 100,000 mesos.
Visit the Cash Shop if you want more slots for storing your styles.\nYou can find the Beauty Salon Slot Coupon in the Hair and Face part of the Appearance Category.
Here, have a Beauty Salon Face Slot Coupon. Change up your style!
It's good to get stronger, but you should look good doing it!
Have you ever been surprised by a giant monster appearing in the field?\n These are called Elite Monsters.
They look just like normal monsters, but are much more powerful. And bigger, obviously.
Elite Monsters show up when you defeat a ton of monsters in one area.\nDon't let them catch you off-guard!
These giant monsters have a small chance to drop special equipment and Maple Reward Points, so fighting them is worth the risk.
Good luck in your Elite Monster hunts!
Good luck in your Elite Monster hunts!
Something special happens to fields that no one visits for a long time.\nIf you happen to find one, you'll get a message about a Burning Field.
Burning Fields give more EXP depending on how long it has been since someone last visited. The bonuses can be huge!
If you get tired of hunting in the same fields, maybe you should go looking for these Burning Fields.
If you get tired of hunting in the same fields, maybe you should go looking for these Burning Fields.
Have you seen this locked slot in your equip inventory?\nThat's for special little doodads called Pocket Items.
If your character's Charm trait is at least Lv. 30, you can use your Pocket Slot.
You can increase your Charm with an item called Cologne, or you can buy an Avatar from the Cash Shop and wear it.
After reaching Lv. 30 Charm, you will receive a quest to get a Rose Clipping.\nComplete that to unlock you Pocket Slot.
There are all kinds of Pocket Items to equip, and you can get them from many sources.\nThey're often given as event rewards.
Make the most of your Pocket Items to get even stronger!
Make the most of your Pocket Items to get even stronger!
If you've fought a lot of Elite Monsters, you may have run into monsters even bigger and scarier, right?
These are Elite Bosses, agents of the Black Mage himself!
Elite Bosses only appear after you take down several Elite Monsters in the same field.\nAll that dark energy is bound to summon the scary guys.
All regular monsters on the map disappear when the Elite Boss appears.\nThere's also a huge warning message you can't miss.
Elite Boss appearances are even marked on the World Map, so it's easier for everyone to team up against them. Or avoid them!
Extra special rewards rain from the heavens when you beat an Elite Boss.\nThis might be your chance to get some really rare scrolls and cubes!
Good luck in your Elite Boss hunts!
Good luck in your Elite Boss hunts!
